page.title: 01THEBERTON, SUFFOLK
page.content: About three quarters of the area is arable land and the rest equally divided between grass for pasture and woodland, largely deciduous. There are 11 large farms and a few smaller ones, whilst some farmhouses are just used as residences. Cottages are used by farmworkers, or as holiday homes; some are let to Americans working at the Bentwaters Airbase, or are homes of retired persons. Two areas are more populated: East Green, with 19 dwellings, 6 being small farms. Here are 37 adults and 15 children. The second such area is Theberton village, with an electoral roll of 203, a thatched church, an inn, no shop but post office facilities in a private house, and most residents work in the small town of Leiston, about 3 miles away.
